The '''PlayStation VR2''' ('''PS VR2''') is an upcoming [[virtual reality headset]] for the [[PlayStation 5]] [[home video game consoles|home video game console]] developed by [[Sony Interactive Entertainment]] set to be released February 22, 2023.<ref name="Verge Preview">{{cite web| url = https://www.theverge.com/2022/9/14/23351946/playstation-vr-psvr-2-hands-on-impressions-horizon-call-of-the-mountain-sony| title = We finally got our hands and eyes on the PlayStation VR2| last = Peters| first = Jay| last2 = Song| first2 = Victoria| date = 14 September 2022| website = [[The Verge]]| publisher = [[Vox Media]]| access-date = 5 October 2022| quote = }}</ref><ref name="cnet hands on">{{cite web| url = https://www.cnet.com/tech/gaming/psvr-2-hands-on-why-the-upcoming-ps5-vr-headset-wowed-us/| title = PlayStation VR 2 Hands-On: Sony's Upcoming PS5 VR Headset Wowed Me| last = Stein| first = Scott| date = 16 September 2022| website = [[CNET]]| publisher = [[Red Ventures]]| access-date = 5 October 2022 | quote = }}</ref>

==History==
Sony's first [[PlayStation VR]] was released in 2016. Sony announced the PlayStation VR2 for the PlayStation 5 at the 2022 [[Consumer Electronics Show]].<ref>{{Cite web|date=February 23, 2021|title=Introducing the next generation of VR on PlayStation|url=https://blog.playstation.com/2021/02/23/introducing-the-next-generation-of-vr-on-playstation/|access-date=October 5, 2022|website=PlayStation.Blog|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.gamespot.com/articles/playstation-vr2-detailed-horizon-call-of-the-mountain-announced/1100-6499345/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f | title = PlayStation VR2 Detailed, Horizon: Call Of The Mountain Announced | first=  Tamoor | last=  Hussain |date = January 4, 2022 | accessdate  = October 5, 2022 | work = [[GameSpot]] }}</ref>

A release date of February 22, 2023, and a retail price of $549.99 was announced in November 2, 2022 at the official [[PlayStation Blog]].<ref>{{Cite web |date=2022-11-02 |title=PlayStation VR2 launches in February at $549.99 |url=https://blog.playstation.com/2022/11/02/playstation-vr2-launches-in-february-at-549-99/ |access-date=2022-11-30 |website=PlayStation.Blog |language=en-US}}</ref>

==Hardware== 
The headset will connect to the PlayStation 5 console with a single [[USB-C]] cable.<ref name="Verge Preview"/> Unlike the first generation PlayStation VR, which tracked player movements through an external [[PlayStation Camera]], the PS VR2 will track movements by four cameras mounted on the headset.<ref name="Verge Preview"/><ref name="cnet hands on"/>

The PlayStation VR2 will have an [[OLED]] panel with a [[4K resolution|4K]] [[display resolution]].<ref name="Verge Preview"/> Each display will have a resolution of 2,000 x 2,040 pixels.<ref name="cnet hands on"/> The headset has two inward-facing eye-tracking cameras. It uses eye-tracking to enable games to use [[Foveated rendering]], a performance optimization technique where the render resolution of the game is reduced in areas where the player is not looking.<ref name="cnet hands on"/>
 
The PS VR2 will also feature the new "Sense" controllers.<ref name="Verge Preview"/> The features of these controllers include the same haptic feedback and adaptive triggers of the [[DualSense]], as well as some limited finger tracking.<ref name="Verge Preview"/>

PS VR2 cannot play [[List of PlayStation VR games|first generation PS VR games]]. Sony explains that this is because the PS VR2 was designed to deliver “a truly next-generation VR experience”.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Carpenter |first=Nicole |date=2022-09-16 |title=PSVR2 isn’t compatible with PSVR games, Sony says |url=https://www.polygon.com/23356951/psvr2-not-backward-compatible-psvr-games |access-date=2022-11-30 |website=Polygon |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=2022-09-16 |title=Official PlayStation Podcast Episode 439: Virtual Impressions |url=https://blog.playstation.com/2022/09/16/official-playstation-podcast-episode-439-virtual-impressions/ |access-date=2022-11-30 |website=PlayStation.Blog |language=en-US}}</ref>

==Games and content==
More than 20 games are in development for PS VR2 from PlayStation Studios and third party partners, including ''[[Resident Evil Village]]'', ''[[The Walking Dead: Saints & Sinners – Chapter 2: Retribution]]'', ''[[No Man's Sky]]'', ''[[Star Wars: Tales from the Galaxy's Edge]]'', ''[[Demeo]]'' and PS VR2 exclusive ''[[Horizon Call of the Mountain]]''.<ref>{{Cite web |title=PS VR2 Tech Specs {{!}} PlayStation VR2 display, setup and compatibility |url=https://www.playstation.com/en-us/ps-vr2/ps-vr2-tech-specs/ |access-date=2022-11-30 |website=PlayStation |language=en-US}}</ref>

==Reception==
Early previews have been positive.<ref name="Verge Preview"/> The Sense controllers received acclaim from CNET.<ref name="cnet hands on"/> The lack of backward compatibility, and the price of the headset received mixed reaction.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Borman |first=Max |date=2022-09-22 |title=PSVR 2 Not Being Backward Compatible with PSVR is a Disservice |url=https://gamerant.com/psvr-2-sony-no-backwards-compatibility-bad-inconvenience-game-preservation-problem/ |access-date=2022-11-30 |website=Game Rant |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=published |first=Dustin Bailey |date=2022-09-16 |title=Sony says PSVR 2 is too good to be backwards compatible with PSVR games |url=https://www.gamesradar.com/sony-says-psvr-2-is-too-good-to-be-backwards-compatible-with-psvr-games/ |access-date=2022-11-30 |website=gamesradar |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=published |first=Duncan Robertson |date=2022-11-02 |title=The PSVR2 price is crazy, but not insane |url=https://www.gamesradar.com/the-psvr2-price-is-crazy-but-not-insane/ |access-date=2022-11-30 |website=gamesradar |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=published |first=Dustin Bailey |date=2022-11-02 |title=VR enthusiasts love the PSVR 2 price - everyone else hates it |url=https://www.gamesradar.com/vr-enthusiasts-love-the-psvr-2-price-everyone-else-hates-it/ |access-date=2022-11-30 |website=gamesradar |language=en}}</ref>
